alert.note: Alert for Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Oglethorpe County through 315 AM EDT... At 240 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Arnoldsville, or 7 miles northwest of Lexington, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Winterville, Crawford, Arnoldsville, Maxeys, Stephens, Dunlap, Smithonia, Philomath and Hutchings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
